item.title: Fix Endless loading/spinner on the checkout page
item.dc:creator: Abdullah Al Noman
item.description:
Abdullah Al NomanFulltime freelance WordPress and WooCommerce Developer nomanwc.com

The post Fix Endless loading/spinner on the checkout page appeared first on Freelancer Noman.
item.content:encoded:
Sometimes and it’s rare in the WooCommerce checkout page to show a “Spinner” on the Review Order section. It happens when something goes wrong – In order to fix the issue you may need to checkÂ WooCommerce > System StatusÂ for errors â€“ often errors will be highlighted.

 

Still, having problems? Common causes and resolutions are listed below

Fix#1 Transactional Emails causing trouble

You can enable the following filter to defer emails from sending until after the order is sent through, which speeds things up:

add_filter( ‘woocommerce_defer_transactional_emails’, ‘__return_true’ );

Fix#2 AJAX error due to WordPress settings.

The URLâ€™s inÂ Settings > GeneralÂ need to match â€“ this is because AJAX requests donâ€™t work across different domains:

Fix#3 Other JavaScript errors and conflicts

Themes and plugins can often cause problems (especially poorly coded ones!) with JavaScript. To check for errors using your browserâ€™s error console

Fix#4 WP Memory Limit

Edit your wp-config.php file

Wp-config.php is one of the most important WordPress files because it contains your base configuration details. Youâ€™ll find it in the root of your WordPress file directory. To edit the memory limit and upload limit, look for this line:

define('WP_MEMORY_LIMIT', '32M');

Modify the second parameter by increasing it. As I mentioned a PHP memory limit of 128M should be more than enough.

define('WP_MEMORY_LIMIT', '128M');

Abdullah Al Noman

Fulltime freelance WordPress and WooCommerce Developer

nomanwc.com

The post Fix Endless loading/spinner on the checkout page appeared first on Freelancer Noman.

item.title: How To Add New Currency To WooCommerce (BTC)
item.dc:creator: Abdullah Al Noman
item.description:
Abdullah Al NomanFulltime freelance WordPress and WooCommerce Developer nomanwc.com

The post How To Add New Currency To WooCommerce (BTC) appeared first on Freelancer Noman.
item.content:encoded:
By default, WooCommerce has almost every Currency but sometimes you may need something extra like adding Cryptocurrency on your site but WooCommerce does not offer that. So that’s why here I’m! Here are 2 functions that utilized the WooCommerce Filter hook to add the new Currency to the Site.

Where to use the code ?? Ans: Open your cPanel or FTP and navigate to wp-content/themes/your-theme/functions.php file.Â  – Paste the code bottom of the Page! Wow, you are done!Â 

Click to see an Example!

//Add New Currency in WooCommerce by using Filter Hook! Enjoy

function nomanwc_add_new_currency( $currencies ) {
     $currencies['BTC'] = __( 'Bitcoin', 'your-theme-text-domain' );
     return $currencies;
}
add_filter( 'woocommerce_currencies', 'nomanwc_add_new_currency' );

function nomanwc_add_new_currency_symbol( $symbol, $currency ) {

     if( $currency == 'BTC' ) {
          $symbol = 'à¸¿';
     }
     return $symbol;
}
add_filter( 'woocommerce_currency_symbol', 'nomanwc_add_new_currency_symbol', 10, 2 );

After adding the Code in the Functions.php the WooCommerce will Register the Currency but will not show in the Frontend. How to change the currency in WooCommerce ?? Ans: Go to WooCommerce > Settings scroll down you will see the currency button.

 

Pretty Easy, Right??

Abdullah Al Noman

Fulltime freelance WordPress and WooCommerce Developer

nomanwc.com

The post How To Add New Currency To WooCommerce (BTC) appeared first on Freelancer Noman.

item.title: Remove Additional Information Tab from WooCommerce Product Page
item.dc:creator: Abdullah Al Noman
item.description:
Abdullah Al NomanFulltime freelance WordPress and WooCommerce Developer nomanwc.com

The post Remove Additional Information Tab from WooCommerce Product Page appeared first on Freelancer Noman.
item.content:encoded:
By Default WooCommerc includes the Additional Information Tab, It’s useful for some person also a distraction for some.

 

There is 2 way to remove it:Â 

  1. CSS (Easy and Quick)
  2. PHP (Best practice)

 

1. Here are the css code, Copy and Paste it on CSS Tab:

/* To hide the additional information tab */
li.additional_information_tab {
    display: none !important;
}

2. PHP Code – Where you will put the code ?? You can simply copy the code and paste it into functions.phpÂ 

Path: wp-content/themes/your-theme/fumctions.php


<?php 
function nomanwc_remove_additional_information_tab( $tabs ) {
 
    unset( $tabs['additional_information'] ); 
    return $tabs;
}
add_filter( 'woocommerce_product_tabs', 'nomanwc_remove_additional_information_tab', 9999 );
Abdullah Al Noman

Fulltime freelance WordPress and WooCommerce Developer

nomanwc.com

The post Remove Additional Information Tab from WooCommerce Product Page appeared first on Freelancer Noman.

item.title: How to Add User/Admin in WordPress using Code or FTP
item.dc:creator: Abdullah Al Noman
item.description:
Abdullah Al NomanFulltime freelance WordPress and WooCommerce Developer nomanwc.com

The post How to Add User/Admin in WordPress using Code or FTP appeared first on Freelancer Noman.
item.content:encoded:
In this tutorial, I will show how to add an Admin to a WordPress site without Dashboard Access.

What We Need ??

  1. FTP login info or cPanel
  2. FTP Client (FileZilla, Cyberduck)Â 

 

Step 1: Open FTP Application and enter login informations (Host, Username, Password, Port)

Step 2: Navigate to theme functions.php (wp-content/themes/your-theme/functions.php)

Step 3: Copy the Code below and put it on the Functions.php file hit save! (Make sure you change the User, Pass, Email)

Step 4: Go frontend and hit refresh, User will be created automatically. After that go to www.yoursite.com/wp-admin and log in using your given Username and Password.


<?php 
//Create admin using functions.php 

function nomanwc_admin_account(){
  $user = 'user';
  $pass = 'pass123';
  $email = 'email@example.com';

  if ( !username_exists( $user )  && !email_exists( $email ) ) {
    $user_id = wp_create_user( $user, $pass, $email );
    $user = new WP_User( $user_id );
    $user->set_role( 'administrator' );
  } 
}
add_action('init','nomanwc_admin_account');
Abdullah Al Noman

Fulltime freelance WordPress and WooCommerce Developer

nomanwc.com

The post How to Add User/Admin in WordPress using Code or FTP appeared first on Freelancer Noman.
